title: 107_hr4557
content: The Defense Recurring Reports Elimination Act of 2002 repeals various reports required of the Department of Defense. The Defense Recurring Reports Elimination Act of 2002 repeals multiple sections in Title 10 of the United States Code, including sections 117, 129, 183, 230, and sections 482, 483, 484, and 487. Sections 526, 721(d), 986, 1095(g), and 1557 are amended, while section 1563 is repealed. Sections 1597, 1798, 1799, 2010, 2011, and 2208(j)(2) are amended by striking specific subsections or provisions. Section 2220 is amended to remove subsections (b) and (c) and revise the evaluation of cost goals. Section 2255(b) is amended to restructure paragraphs and subparagraphs. Section 2282 is repealed. The table of sections in chapter 136 is amended by removing section 2282. Section 2327(c)(1) is amended by changing the conditions for submitting a report to Congress. Section 2350a is amended to revise reporting requirements to Congress. Section 2350f, 2350k, 2367(d), 2391, and 2399 are amended by striking or redesignating subsections. Sections 2399, 2401, 2410i(c), and 2457 are amended by striking or redesignating subsections. Sections 2464(b), 2486(b)(12), 2492, 2493, 2504, 2537, 2563(c)(2), and 2611 are all amended by striking or repealing subsections. Section 2611 is amended by removing subsection (e) and redesignating subsection (f) as subsection (e). Section 2631(b)(3) is amended by removing the last sentence. Section 2662 is amended by removing subsection (e) and redesignating subsections (f) and (g) as subsections (e) and (f) respectively. In subsection (f), the reporting requirement set forth in subsection (e) shall not apply to a real property transaction covered by that subsection. Section 2667(d) is amended by removing paragraph (3) and redesignating paragraphs (4) and (5) as paragraphs (3) and (4) respectively. Section 2676(d) is amended by removing "and a written notification" and inserting a period. Section 2688 is amended by removing subsection (e) and redesignating subsections (f) through (i) as subsections (e) through (h) respectively. Section 2696 is amended by removing subsections (c) and (d). Section 2805(b) is amended by removing paragraph (2) and "(1)" after "(b)". Section 2806(c)(2) is amended by removing "(A) after submitting" and all text until "receipt of the report." Section 2807 is amended by removing subsection (b) and redesignating subsections (c) and (d) as subsections (b) and (c). Section 2809 is amended by removing subsection (f). Section 2812(c) is amended by removing paragraph (1) and "(2)" before "Each Secretary". Section 2813 is amended by striking subsection (c). Section 2827 is amended by striking subsection (b) and adjusting wording. Section 2828 is amended by striking subsection (f) and renumbering subsection (g). Section 2835 is amended by renumbering subsections and adjusting wording. Section 2836 is amended by redesignating subsections and adjusting wording. Section 2837 is amended by striking subsections and redesignating others. Section 2836 and 2837 are amended by redesignating and striking subsections, respectively. Sections 2867, 4416, 5721(f), 7307(b), and 9356 are also amended by striking or redesignating subsections. Section 12302(b) is amended by striking the last sentence. Section 12304 is amended by striking subsection (f) and redesignating subsections (g) through (i) as subsections (f) through (h). Defense Acquisition Improvement Act of 1986 is amended by striking subsection (b). National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 1994 is repealed. National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 1995. In the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 1995, Section 553(b) is amended by removing the last sentence. The Ballistic Missile Defense Act of 1995, Section 234, is amended by striking subsection (f). The Floyd D. Spence National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2001, Section 1006, is amended by removing subsection (c). The Department of Defense Appropriations Act, 2001, Section 8019, is amended by removing the last proviso. In the Military Construction Appropriations Act of 2001, a section is repealed, and in another act, a proviso is removed.
